p: Studies with species of the same genus, such as L. multiflora Moldenke, showed that the essential oils obtained from the leaves, flowers, branches, and roots do notvary in chemical profile, and the composition was essentially dominated by monoterpenes [ 38]. Similarly, the volatiles of the vegetative parts (leaves and branches, flowers, and fruit) of Lippia citriodora were characterized as having the same constituents in all parts of the plant: geranial (30.67–36.87%), neral (21.71–28.33%), and limonene (6.07–7.27%) [ 37].
